result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl Jordan Oliver

records.addlTxt: Jury instructions for plea; Received and Filed.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Earl Jordan Oliver not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel requests Motion Hearing and Jury Trial dates. Court grants request and sets the following deadlines: 11/15/2022 deadline for the state to file a response to defense's motion. 11/15/2022 deadline for any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed. Court orders case adjourned to Br 16.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion to Suppress - Statements
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion to Suppress - Automobile Search

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Earl Jordan Oliver not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has discovery and is requesting a motion hearing. Court sets 08/03/2022 by 5:00pm as the deadline to file motions. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Earl Jordan Oliver in court, appear by video with attorney Theodore OReilly, appear by video.  Defendant Earl Jordan Oliver in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to case 19CF3021. Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer T.Klahorst.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earl Jordan Oliver not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Earl Jordan Oliver not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. NO DRIVING DURING THE PENDENCY OF THIS CASE. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

10:42 AM Defendant Earl Jordan Oliver in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Earl Jordan Oliver in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
